## Description {#details}

This file supports working with JSON data.

It comprises:


<ul>
<li>classes which hold dynamically-typed parsed JSON structures These are value types that can be composed, inspected, and modified. See json::Value, and the related types json::Object and json::Array.</li>
<li>functions to parse JSON text into Values, and to serialize Values to text. See <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/gsym/linetable-cpp/#a45e99fb329714d8911cb5e116eb8a3bc">parse()</a>, operator&lt;&lt;, and format&#95;provider.</li>
<li>a convention and helpers for mapping between json::Value and user-defined types. See fromJSON(), ObjectMapper, and the class comment on Value.</li>
<li>an output API json::OStream which can emit JSON without materializing all structures as json::Value.</li>
</ul>


Typically, JSON data would be read from an external source, parsed into a Value, and then converted into some native data structure before doing real work on it. (And vice versa when writing).

Other serialization mechanisms you may consider:


<ul>
<li>YAML is also text-based, and more human-readable than JSON. It&#39;s a more complex format and data model, and YAML parsers aren&#39;t ubiquitous. <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/yamlparser-h">YAMLParser.h</a> is a streaming parser suitable for parsing large documents (including JSON, as YAML is a superset). It can be awkward to use directly. YAML I/O (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/yamltraits-h">YAMLTraits.h</a>) provides data mapping that is more declarative than the toJSON/fromJSON conventions here.</li>
<li>LLVM bitstream is a space- and CPU- efficient binary format. Typically it encodes LLVM IR (&quot;bitcode&quot;), but it can be a container for other data. Low-level reader/writer libraries are in Bitstream/Bitstream&#42;.h</li>
</ul>

<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// === String encodings ===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// JSON strings are character sequences (not byte sequences like std::string).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We need to know the encoding, and for simplicity only support UTF-8.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - When parsing, invalid UTF-8 is a syntax error like any other</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - When creating Values from strings, callers must ensure they are UTF-8.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        with asserts on, invalid UTF-8 will crash the program</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        with asserts off, we&#39;ll substitute the replacement character (U+FFFD)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     Callers can use json::isUTF8() and json::fixUTF8() for validation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - When retrieving strings from Values (e.g. asString()), the result will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     always be valid UTF-8.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> T&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/json/#a03041d200886efaf9203b536e55472c8"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">constexpr</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/json/#a03041d200886efaf9203b536e55472c8">is&#95;uint&#95;64&#95;bit&#95;v</a> =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlight">    std::is&#95;integral&#95;v&lt;T&gt; &amp;&amp; std::is&#95;unsigned&#95;v&lt;T&gt; &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Replaces invalid UTF-8 sequences in \\p S with the replacement character</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (U+FFFD). The returned string is valid UTF-8.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is much slower than isUTF8, so test that first.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::string <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/json/#ab64ede9b347ffd8eb32ed5e05f2520f4">fixUTF8</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">llvm::StringRef</a> S);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An Array is a JSON array, which contains heterogeneous JSON values.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/array/#a577f89cabd6b87d3b0df083ebec242d9">operator==</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/array">Array</a> &amp;L, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/array">Array</a> &amp;R);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/json/#afc052ddf65a95b725f3f0ba0c2857ede"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/json/#ad1e27ac5e9571156b1f36b2c4138a150">operator!=</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/array">Array</a> &amp;L, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/array">Array</a> &amp;R) &#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> !(L == R); &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A Value is an JSON value of unknown type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// They can be copied, but should generally be moved.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// === Composing values ===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// You can implicitly construct Values from:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - strings: std::string, SmallString, formatv, StringRef, char&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              (char&#42;, and StringRef are references, not copies!)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - numbers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - booleans</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - null: nullptr</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - arrays: &#123;&quot;foo&quot;, 42.0, false&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - serializable things: types with toJSON(const T&amp;)-&gt;Value, found by ADL</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// They can also be constructed from object/array helpers:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - json::Object is a type like map&lt;ObjectKey, Value&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - json::Array is a type like vector&lt;Value&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// These can be list-initialized, or used to build up collections in a loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// json::ary(Collection) converts all items in a collection to Values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// === Inspecting values ===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Each Value is one of the JSON kinds:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   null    (nullptr&#95;t)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   boolean (bool)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   number  (double, int64 or uint64)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   string  (StringRef)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   array   (json::Array)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   object  (json::Object)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The kind can be queried directly, or implicitly via the typed accessors:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   if (std::optional&lt;StringRef&gt; S = E.getAsString()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     assert(E.kind() == Value::String);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Array and Object also have typed indexing accessors for easy traversal:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Expected&lt;Value&gt; E = parse(R&quot;( &#123;&quot;options&quot;: &#123;&quot;font&quot;: &quot;sans-serif&quot;&#125;&#125; )&quot;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   if (Object&#42; O = E-&gt;getAsObject())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     if (Object&#42; Opts = O-&gt;getObject(&quot;options&quot;))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       if (std::optional&lt;StringRef&gt; Font = Opts-&gt;getString(&quot;font&quot;))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         assert(Opts-&gt;at(&quot;font&quot;).kind() == Value::String);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// === Converting JSON values to C++ types ===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The convention is to have a deserializer function findable via ADL:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     fromJSON(const json::Value&amp;, T&amp;, Path) -&gt; bool</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The return value indicates overall success, and Path is used for precise</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// error reporting. (The Path::Root passed in at the top level fromJSON call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// captures any nested error and can render it in context).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If conversion fails, fromJSON calls Path::report() and immediately returns.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This ensures that the first fatal error survives.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Deserializers are provided for:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - bool</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - int and int64&#95;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - double</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - std::string</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - vector&lt;T&gt;, where T is deserializable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - map&lt;string, T&gt;, where T is deserializable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - std::optional&lt;T&gt;, where T is deserializable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ObjectMapper can help writing fromJSON() functions for object types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For conversion in the other direction, the serializer function is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    toJSON(const T&amp;) -&gt; json::Value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If this exists, then it also allows constructing Value from T, and can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// be used to serialize vector&lt;T&gt;, map&lt;string, T&gt;, and std::optional&lt;T&gt;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// === Serialization ===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Values can be serialized to JSON:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   1) raw&#95;ostream &lt;&lt; Value                    // Basic formatting.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   2) raw&#95;ostream &lt;&lt; formatv(&quot;&#123;0&#125;&quot;, Value)    // Basic formatting.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   3) raw&#95;ostream &lt;&lt; formatv(&quot;&#123;0:2&#125;&quot;, Value)  // Pretty-print with indent 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// And parsed:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Expected&lt;Value&gt; E = json::parse(&quot;&#91;1, 2, null&#93;&quot;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   assert(E &amp;&amp; E-&gt;kind() == Value::Array);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/value"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/value/#a5cc951dfde24b2071254600cded9c06d">Value</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight">... U&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> create(U &amp;&amp;... V) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if LLVM&#95;ADDRESS&#95;SANITIZER&#95;BUILD</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Unpoisoning to prevent overwriting poisoned object (e.g., annotated short</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// string). Objects that have had their memory poisoned may cause an ASan</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// error if their memory is reused without calling their destructor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Unpoisoning the memory prevents this error from occurring.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: This is a temporary solution to prevent buildbots from failing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  The more appropriate approach would be to call the object&#39;s destructor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  to unpoison memory. This would prevent any potential memory leaks (long</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  strings). Read for details:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/79065#discussion&#95;r1462621761</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a820fe7b3006fe7b31f19b0258993606a">&#95;&#95;asan&#95;unpoison&#95;memory&#95;region</a>(&amp;Union, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ObjectKey is a used to capture keys in Object. Like Value but:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - only strings are allowed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - it&#39;s optimized for the string literal case (Owned == nullptr)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Like Value, strings must be UTF-8. See isUTF8 documentation for details.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00911" /><CodeLine lineNumber="911"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Version of parse() that converts the parsed value to the type T.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// RootName describes the root object and is used in error messages.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> T&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/json/#a36aa5495fb3dabd7ca441a1545495e59"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;T&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/json/#a15ac4901fb02274b34ca5df73bd40c25">parse</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">llvm::StringRef</a> &amp;JSON, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;RootName = </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// json::OStream allows writing well-formed JSON without materializing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="926"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// all structures as json::Value ahead of time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="927"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It&#39;s faster, lower-level, and less safe than OS &lt;&lt; json::Value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="928"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It also allows emitting more constructs, such as comments.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Only one &quot;top-level&quot; object can be written to a stream.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Simplest usage involves passing lambdas (Blocks) to fill in containers:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="933"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   json::OStream J(OS);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   J.array(&#91;&amp;&#93;&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     for (const Event &amp;E : Events)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       J.object(&#91;&amp;&#93; &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         J.attribute(&quot;timestamp&quot;, int64&#95;t(E.Time));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         J.attributeArray(&quot;participants&quot;, &#91;&amp;&#93; &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           for (const Participant &amp;P : E.Participants)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///             J.value(P.toString());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         &#125;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       &#125;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#125;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This would produce JSON like:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#91;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       &quot;timestamp&quot;: 19287398741,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       &quot;participants&quot;: &#91;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         &quot;King Kong&quot;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         &quot;Miley Cyrus&quot;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         &quot;Cleopatra&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       &#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     &#125;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The lower level begin/end methods (arrayBegin()) are more flexible but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// care must be taken to pair them correctly:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="961"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="962"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   json::OStream J(OS);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="963"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    J.arrayBegin();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="964"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   for (const Event &amp;E : Events) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="965"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     J.objectBegin();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="966"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     J.attribute(&quot;timestamp&quot;, int64&#95;t(E.Time));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="967"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     J.attributeBegin(&quot;participants&quot;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="968"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     for (const Participant &amp;P : E.Participants)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="969"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       J.value(P.toString());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="970"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     J.attributeEnd();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="971"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     J.objectEnd();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="972"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="973"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   J.arrayEnd();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="974"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="975"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If the call sequence isn&#39;t valid JSON, asserts will fire in debug mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="976"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This can be mismatched begin()/end() pairs, trying to emit attributes inside</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="977"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// an array, and so on.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="978"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// With asserts disabled, this is undefined behavior.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="979" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream/#a2601b35821c232bc7f2e68f7db52fdbb">OStream</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="980"><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="981" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream/#ae5c537c76bd3b93f03bf4bbbbc489280"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream/#ae5c537c76bd3b93f03bf4bbbbc489280">Block</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">llvm::function&#95;ref</a>&lt;void()&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="982"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If IndentSize is nonzero, output is pretty-printed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="983" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream/#a2601b35821c232bc7f2e68f7db52fdbb"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">explicit</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream/#a2601b35821c232bc7f2e68f7db52fdbb">OStream</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">llvm::raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IndentSize = 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="984"><span class="doxyHighlight">      : OS(OS), IndentSize(IndentSize) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="985"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Stack.emplace&#95;back();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="986"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1024"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1025"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Emit a JavaScript comment associated with the next printed value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1026"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The string must be valid until the next attribute or value is emitted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1027"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Comments are not part of standard JSON, and many parsers reject them!</span></CodeLine>
